turns.text: Um are you from this area
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Well Im in Dallas right now but I live in Garland
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um well I dont know if you know but Garland has got real big recycling center that in fact we went to it yesterday You drive up and you take the stuff out of your trunk and they have different bins for the different materials like clear glass and colored glass and plastics and uh they have all the different plastics separated by those little symbols on the bottom Thats pretty neat My my daughter is four and shes real interested in recycling
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So were were trying to promote that because she thought we just put them in special trash can and threw them away but we went to the recycling center to show her what we actually did with them Uh does Dallas have curbside recycling program yet
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um well I dont know Dallas in Richardson does
turns.label: no

turns.text: Um they started with newspapers and uh of course aluminum cans and --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and bottles and plastic I didnt know there were different types of plastic though

Yeah um like soda bottles are one kin- one type of plastic and milk jugs are one type of plastic You can te- - its got little - most of the recyclable containers have the little symbol on the bottom with the with the arrows around it --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- that tells whether its one or two or three
Its its just different kinds of plastics like the clear plastic is different from that milky looking plastic
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And thats thats what the different types are
turns.label: sd

turns.text: It seems to be made out of something different
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- I I know theres long scientific name but its like polytechnochloride and all that fun stuff
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um I I dont know if they do it all over but our Kroger does newspaper recycling every Saturday You can drive up and they have one of the clerks up there no the bag boys out there um that will take the papers newspaper out of your car and theyll put it in their little bin and they do the recycling I mean they collect the newspapers and their pla- their plastic grocery bags --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- which I think is pretty neat Thats something since we all seem to have an abundance of those plastic grocery bags
I know we use them for trash can liners and --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah in fact I have one today
turns.label: aa

turns.text: The only problem with those is sometimes they get holes in the bottom
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Its like whoops there goes my chips --
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: Now I - in fact did you happen to see TWENTY TWENTY the other night

They did program or th- one of their articles was on recycling and uh it was actually on town that has dump that they charge other cities or towns to come in and dump their trash there They have made so much money from that that they built they bought brand new fire engine and when the fire engine was delivered the fire house wasnt big enough so they bo- bought new or built new one -- -- and paid for it in cash with the money that theyve earned from this landfill
turns.label: sd

turns.text: They have built up one mountain They call it Mount Trashmore
turns.label: sd

turns.text: They built up one mountain covered it with grass and put ski lifts on it and in the winter they put snow on it and they charge to ski on it So the city gets the money from that they built golf course at the bottom and they get the money from that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Is like - thats - its its Riverview Ohio or some place up there
But it was I thought it was pretty neat idea They I mean their city hall looked better it was nicer than Dallas and they only have fourteen thousand people in the city
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And they like the trash So - Well okay But I thought it was pretty neat It it would be nice if more communities could do that but you have to know from beginning and you have to have the space to do it and -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah theyll run out of space before long
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Yeah see thats - well theyre already planning second mountain
turns.label: aa

turns.text: So theyre going to get going to be called the Twin Peaks I was like uh-huh Go back two shows This it would be nice if more communities could get really involved in recycling It - I know Ive got two year old and four year old and thats - my daughter thinks that any time she sees newspapers bundled up theyre being recycled
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So its like well no Honey So that like - so that was one reason we went to show her what people did with their their stuff when they recycled it --
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: -- and try to explain well yeah you melt down the cans and you make them into new things and you get the paper all wet and you make it into new paper and thats fun trying to explain that to four year old
Um so do you all go ahead
turns.label: qy

turns.text: They dont even know that paper comes from trees now so -
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well yeah she - that was her next question was how do you grow paper
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- um Thats why you have to cut down trees and why you have to plant more trees
And how do you grow aluminum
turns.label: ^q

turns.text: Well lets see um we really dont but And then she was like well what do you do with the glass Well you crunch it up real small and then you melt it down Well what if it breaks Well okay It it it was an interesting weekend trying to explain all that fun stuff to her
turns.label: ^h

turns.text: But at least she knows that that is something that people need to be doing and she got our baby-sitter to start recycling her newspapers and cans because thats all she talked about
